title: Arabic North Levantine - Genesis Portion
title_vernacular: العربية الشمالية الشامية - جزء من سفر التكوين
description: Fragments of the Book of Genesis in Lebanese translated by the Trinitarian Bible Society in 1981 (?). Lebanese is largely spoken in Palestine. Morris Sigel Seale (14 July 1896 – 29 August 1993) was a Jewish born scholar and theologian who wrote about Jewish, Christian and Muslim traditions and explored extensively the links between the religions. He wrote three influential books and contributed numerous articles to Theological journals including the Journal of Biblical Literature and The Muslim World. He studied theology at Queen's University of Belfast and served on an Irish Presbyterian mission in Damascus, having converted from Judaism.

language.name: North Levantine Arabic
language.area: Also in Antigua and Barbuda, Argentina, Belize, Cyprus, Dominican Republic, Egypt, French Guiana, Israel, Jamaica, Lebanon, Mali, Puerto Rico, Suriname, Trinidad and Tobago, Turkey (Asia).
